description.p: You can make a Hermeticist quickly by following these suggestions. First, make your spellcasting ability your highest ability score. Second, choose the sage background.
As a hermeticist, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 6 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d6 (or 4) + your Constitution modifier per hermeticist level after 1st
Skills: Choose two from Acrobatics, Arcana, Athletics, History, Insight, Investigation, and Perception.

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a component pouch or (b) an arcane focus
(a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) any simple weapon
(a) a scholar’s pack or (b) an explorer’s pack

sheet.description: A magic user who can freely cast magic that don't challenge the established limits of Hermetic Theory.

setters.set: A scholarly magic-user capable of manipulating the structures of reality.

multiclass.prerequisite: Constitution 13 and Intelligence 13, Wisdom 13, or Charisma 13

description.p: Starting at 1st level, you have attained the ability to manipulate the raw energies of the world, so long as you operate under a set of rules. To create spells you can combine different Techniques and Forms to achieve different effects. Careful preparation is required for all but the most advanced Hermetic Mages.

Spellcraft is your power to manipulate and control different aspects of Hermetic Magic. In order to cast a spell you must expend Spellcraft equal to the cost of the spell. Your Spellcraft equals your Spell Level, and you regain all spent Spellcraft at the start of each of your turns.

Starting at 1st level, you can attune yourself to the weave, channeling its energies into yourself allowing access to magic. As an action you can open yourself up to the weave, filling yourself with its power. While channeling, other Hermeticists will be able to tell if you are holding the weave by an aura that surrounds you. Channeling too much through the weave has the potential to burn yourself out if you’re not careful, however, and caution is advised to ensure you don’t lose yourself to its addictive power. You gain one level of fatigue for every hour you channel. If you have levels of fatigue already, your current fatigue doubles for every hour instead.

If you attempt to cast a spell that is beyond your safe limit for channeling, you gain one level of fatigue for every level past your Spellcraft limit. The more fatigue you have, the longer you will need to take a break to recover before channeling again. 1 minute at 1 (Winded), 10 minutes at 2 (Weary), 30 minutes at 3 (Tired), and 1 hour at 4 (Dazed). At 5+ levels, you cannot channel again until you finish a long rest. You cannot channel during the recovery period. At 6+ levels of fatigue you are forced to drop channeling. If you somehow accumulate 10 levels of fatigue, you burn out. You lose access to channeling and can only regain the ability to do so with a wish spell.

The Hermeticism table shows your Spell Level, which increases as you level, allowing you to cast more powerful spells of which you are trained in. You can only cast one spell with a magnitude component, and gain the ability to do so again at the start of each of your turns.
Your spellcasting ability is determined by your hermetic study. See the Study feature of your hermetic study for your spellcasting ability.

Some spell effects do not remain permanent upon being cast. Using Creo to heal a wound will only suppress the effects until the duration ends, never truly healing it. In order to bypass this limit, a ritual cast must take place, consuming raw magical energy, vis, in the process. Ritual casts take 10 minutes, and can cast spells with a duration of Until Dispelled or Triggered, or Permanent.
Hermetic magic is imperfect, and there are some things outside of its realm of influence. Spells you cast cannot defy these limitations.
Limit of Aging. Cannot halt or reverse aging.
Limit of Arcane Connections. Cannot affect an un-sensed target without an arcane connection.
Limit of Concentration. While concentrating on a spell with a magnitude, you cannot cast another magnitude spell. You expend 1 Spellcraft at the start of each of your turns to maintain Concentration.
Limit of Creation. Cannot create anything permanently without expending vis. Can only maintain one magical beast at a time, and spells to create or control beasts require concentration.
Limit of Depth. A creature can only be affected by one buff and debuff, and duration magnitude spell inflicted by Hermeticism at any given time.
Limit of Energy. Cannot restore one’s own physical energy.

Limit of Healing. Without access to ritual magic, Creo spells that attempt to heal a wound instead grant temporary hit points that last until the duration ends. Granting temporary hit points in this way does not scale with spell level increases to magnitude.
Limit of the Infernal. Detection magic is useless against demons(reveals only what that demon wants you to believe).
Limit of Longevity. Duration spells with magnitude do not scale with spell level increases to magnitude.
Limit of Resistance. A creature under the effects of a debuff or duration magnitude spell can repeat their saving throw to dispel the effect at the start of each of their turns.
Limit of the Soul. Cannot create an immortal soul.
Limit of Time. Cannot alter passage of time. Cannot affect past or directly affect future.
Limit of True Feeling. Some strong instances of love/friendship/faith cannot be altered.

Vis is the raw magical energy of any given Hermetic form, and can be “burned” to enhance or grant new abilities temporarily. Vis is produced at the end of a long rest, provided at least 1 hour is spent on focusing the energy through meditation. You gain one mote of each form you are proficient in at the end of a long rest: small pills that reflect their source form. These motes dissolve at the end of your next long rest. In order to use Vis, these motes must be consumed as an action. As a bonus action or reaction, you can burn any consumed Vis to activate a unique effect depending on the burnt Form. The duration of the effect is dependent on the Form being burnt. You can stop burning any number of active Vis forms as a free action, leaving any of its unused duration still unburnt. If the user finishes a long rest while they have consumed Vis that hasn’t been fully burnt, they are poisoned until the end of their next long rest.

Air (1 hour) While burning can’t be charmed, channeling and burning goes unnoticed, spells require no V,S,M components. Can also smoke those you choose within 30ft of you, rendering their channeling and burning unnoticeable as well.

Earth (10 minutes) While burning, once per turn you can push and pull metals based on your weight, can affect and sense any metals within 60ft of you by pushing and pulling on thin blue lines that allow you to sense nearby metal. The metal objects can collide with creatures. Make an attack roll using your Spell Attack modifier when necessary. If it hits, the creature takes 1d12 damage of a type determined by the object.
Fire (1 hour) While burning you gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception, Insight) checks, Dexterity saving throws, and you gain an additional reaction.

Life (1 minute) While burning you can use your Intelligence modifier instead of your Strength/Dexterity modifier for Strength/Dexterity based ability checks, weapons, and saving throws. You gain advantage on Death Saving throws.

Mind (10 minutes) While burning you can detect emotions of creatures you can see, and you gain advantage on Charisma based ability checks as you bend their emotions. As a bonus action you can attempt to soothe a target to get them to drop their guard temporarily. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be charmed by you until the end of your next turn.

Water (10 minutes) While burning you can read the weaves of any magic being used by a Hermeticist you can see that isn’t smoked. You know the exact spell being cast, and can use your reaction to dismantle the weave by making a contested Arcana check against them.
You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your hermeticist spells.

description.p: Choose a Hermetic Study, which describes how your gift manifests. Your choice grants you features when you choose it at 1st level and again at 3rd, 6th, 10th, 14th, and 20th level.
You gain proficiency in one Hermetic Techniques and Form. Spells cast using your major can consist of one non proficient Technique or Form at spell level 1.
Trained techniques and forms create more efficient spells that utilize them.
Proficiency with a technique and form allows you to use your full spellcraft limit.

Additionally, you can modify existing spells with additional techniques and forms you are trained in to cast a complex spell. Complex spells only retain their proficiency bonuses if all techniques and forms are trained.
You gain proficiency in one Hermetic Techniques and Form.

Starting at 2nd level, you gain the ability to create small fragments of Vis, which can temporarily store magic inside them. When you cast a spell, you can condense the spell’s energy into a fragment of vis embodying the form used to create it.

A creature holding this fragment can use its action to release the spell within, whereupon the fragment disappears. The spell uses your attack bonus and save DC, and the spell treats the creature who released it as the caster for all other purposes, but cannot be negated through burning Water.

Additionally, the fragment can be burnt temporarily. Consuming the fragment takes an action, and confers the benefits of one of the forms you are proficient in while burning. This fragment is unusually unstable however, and lasts for its duration regardless of whether or not you are actively burning it.

Once you create a bead with this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Attempting to create a second bead will destroy the first, vanishing in a flash of light, losing the spell and removing the capacity to burn it.

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
You gain proficiency in light armor, medium armor, shields, simple weapons, and martial weapons.

description.p: You have made a deal with a demon, altering your magic and physique.
Your casting advancement is determined by your Demonic Contract.

description.p: Not satisfied with the limitations of hermetic magic, you have formed a contract with a powerful shard demon. Through this contract, your hermetic abilities are modified depending on the demon contracted. The demon you are contracted to is determined by your major form :

While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Constitution modifier + your Charisma modifier + your spell level. You gain proficiency in all weapons. Your spell level is equal to your Hermeticist level divided by 6 (minimum of 1). You gain additional hit points whenever you level up equal to 1 + your spell level. You add your spell level to your attack and damage rolls while channeling.

sheet.description: You add your spell level to your attack and damage rolls while channeling.

description.p: You are considered a half caster for the purposes of spell level advancement and proficiencies. Your major form is mastered, all spells cast using your major form are cast at full strength. You learn one stance and one fighting style.

sheet.description: Your major form is mastered, all spells cast using your major form are cast at full strength.

description.p: You are considered a full caster for the purposes of spell level advancement and proficiencies. Your major form and technique are mastered, all spells cast using your major form or technique are cast at full strength. You gain access to Signature Spells, spells crafted using only your majors and minors. Signature Spells have their spell level increased by your Hermeticist level divided by 6 (minimum of 1).

sheet.description: Your major form and technique are mastered, all spells cast using your major form or technique are cast at full strength. You gain access to Signature Spells, spells crafted using only your majors and minors. Signature Spells have their spell level increased by {{spell level:signature}}.

description.p: Starting at level 3, you develop a minor control of the mana space around you. As a reaction for 1 fatigue, whenever a spell is cast within 15ft of you, you can increase or reduce its spell level by 1.

sheet.description: Whenever a spell is cast within {{mana:zone}}ft of you, you can increase or reduce its spell level by 1.

description.p: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: Starting at level 6, as an action or as part of the action to begin channeling, you can surrender yourself to your shard demon for 1 minute, temporarily transforming into it. You take damage equal to twice your level; you can't recover Hit Points lost in this way by any means until you complete a long rest. While demonized, you are always channeling (this does not induce fatigue), channeling cannot be detected, and can use your mana zone without inducing fatigue.

description.p: You gain resistance to all damage. At the start of each of your turns you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution + Charisma modifier. Whenever you deal damage with a melee attack, you deal additional necrotic damage equal to your Hermeticist level. Your unarmed strikes deal 1d12 slashing damage, and are considered magical.

description.p: Starting at level 10, once per turn you can teleport anywhere inside your mana zone.
Additionally, as a reaction whenever you are targeted by a spell inside your mana zone, you can redirect the spell to another target within it.

description.p: Starting at level 14, you have reached the pinnacle of your contract, and fuse forms with your shard demon to create a terrifying Shard Devil, humanoid hosts of refined demonic power.

You are always under the effects of Demonization, but your appearance does not change into that of your demon. Instead, you gain a timeless sleek crystalline appearance. You are considered a Fiend, and age 1 year for every 10 you would normally. Your Mana Zone’s range increases to 30 feet.
Additionally, through your refinement into a Shard Devil, you gain additional benefits from your Demonic Contract.

description.p: You have been touched by Stastra, and she has enhanced your awareness of your soul. While channeling, as an action on your turn and next turn you can ritual cast a spell by concentrating on its casting until the end of your next turn.
You are considered a full caster for the purposes of spell level advancement and proficiencies.

Starting at first level, you learn how to imbue a fragment of your soul into a constellation that contains a magical effect. Whenever you ritual cast a spell you can choose to instead create a constellation. A constellation inherits the effects of the spell, but remains dormant. You can activate a dormant constellation for 1 fatigue as an action which can be used as part of the action to begin channeling. Constellations can be inscribed onto different objects or onto your skin as an action. Constellations cannot have a duration of Concentration unless you inscribe it on your skin, and you must abide by the standard rules of Concentration for it. You can create a number of Constellations up to your Wisdom modifier(minimum of 1), and attempting to create one past this limit automatically destroys the oldest Constellation.

As a bonus action on each of your turns you can ignite any number of your Constellations without incurring fatigue. At the end of the duration, you gain fatigue equal to the number of unique Constellations activated.

At the end of the duration, your Constellations are destroyed as if they had been removed by your Eater of Worlds feature.

description.p: You have been exposed to ancient technology, and from it you gained the ability to understand the structure of any non living construct. With a profound understanding of the laws of creation, and the ability to analyze the composition of matter, you are second to none when it comes to understanding advanced mechanizations and designs. While channeling, you can finely tune your Area of Effect spells, rendering those you wish immune to its effects.
You are considered a full caster for the purposes of spell level advancement and proficiencies.

Additionally, whenever you cast a spell with an AoE component, you can choose to use your Domain as the Area of Effect instead.

One curse, including the target’s attunement to a cursed magic item.
Any reduction to one of the target’s ability scores.

sheet.description: You can spend Vis to undo debilitating effects. You can reduce the target’s exhaustion level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target: Stacks of Fatigue One effect that charmed, blinded, deafened, paralyzed, poisoned, or petrified the target. One curse, including the target’s attunement to a cursed magic item. Any reduction to one of the target’s ability scores. One effect reducing the target’s hit point maximum.

description.p: Starting at level 14, frequent exposure to your angelic nature has enabled you to enter a temporary state of full angelification for 1 minute as an action while channeling, or as part of the action used to begin channeling. In a full angelification state, you are immune to non magical piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage. Your purity increases by 2 at the start of every turn, and is no longer capped.
Additionally, while in this state Mend does not inflict fatigue, and the amount of temporary hit points is increased by your spell level. You suffer three levels of fatigue upon exiting this state.

sheet.description: While, or as part of the action used to begin channeling, you can fully angelificate for 1 minute. While in this state, you are immune to non magical piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage. Your purity increases by 2 at the start of every turn, and is no longer capped. Additionally, while in this state Mend does not inflict fatigue, and the amount of temporary hit points is increased by your spell level {{spell level:usage}}.

description.p: Starting at level 20, you are no longer bound by lesser limits, and have ascended to the divine state.
You have successfully halted the process of aging.
You gain immunity to radiant damage, and are considered a celestial.
You can use purity instead of Vis for your Restoration feature.

sheet.description: You have successfully halted the process of aging. You are considered a celestial. You can use purity instead of Vis for your Restoration feature.
Your Spellcasting Ability Modifier is Blight +{{hermeticist:spellcasting:modifier}}.

description.p: You were gifted with the damning power of blight, a strong maddening magic source represented by tar and blackness. This gift is slowly driving you mad, but infuses you with an unreal power. Do not be consumed by this power, as overuse will surely spell your doom. Your spell level increases by 1. While channeling, other Hermeticists can detect a sickly aura around you. Most people are hostile to or afraid of those they know with Blight.

Once you connect to the blight, make a madness check. The DC is equal to 8 + your tier of madness + your fatigue, and you add your spellcasting modifier to the roll. Tiers of madness are detailed at the end of the subclass description.
Channeling requires one Madness check for every additional hour it is active. When you stop channeling the blight, your fatigue increases by 1.
You are considered a full caster for the purposes of spell level advancement and proficiencies.

sheet.description: Once you connect to the blight, make a madness check. The DC is equal to 8 + your tier of madness + your fatigue, and you add your spellcasting modifier to the roll. Channeling requires one Madness check for every additional hour it is active. When you stop channeling the blight, your fatigue increases by 1.

description.p: At 3rd level, when you finish a long rest you can choose another Form and Technique. You gain proficiency in those as if you learned them from your minor feature until you finish your next long rest.

sheet.description: When you finish a long rest you can choose another Form and Technique. You gain proficiency in those as if you learned them from your minor feature until you finish your next long rest.

description.p: At 6th level, you begin to pick up talents seemingly foreign to you. You gain the proficiencies of a half caster, and learn one Stance which you can enter into as a bonus action.

At 10th level, the depths of your mind are impossibly deep and treacherous. You gain resistance to psychic damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. If you would gain resistance to psychic damage through another feature, instead you gain immunity, and you cannot be affected by spells lower than half your spell level rounded up.
Additionally, any attempts at invading your mind are met with shrieks of anguish and crazed laughter, inflicting Indefinite Madness on the invader.

description.p: At 14th level, your connection to the blight enables you to see through the fabric of reality. You gain 60ft of Truesight.

Additionally, you can use an action to step into or out of the Ethereal Plane, as if casting Etherealness. This feature can also be used to enter your Rift from anywhere else besides a gate, although you cannot take others with you as you normally would.

description.p: Starting at level 20, if you are sane, you learn to accept the voices in your head. You gain proficiency in all techniques and forms, and no longer adhere to the rules regarding madness.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency in all techniques and forms, and no longer adhere to the rules regarding madness.

description.p: When you create a Maniac Hermeticist, you gain a resource called Sanity that decreases as your connection with the blight strengthens, eating away at your mind. Your starting Sanity is equal to 80 + 1d20. Your madness decreases by 1d6 everytime you gain a level in this class. If you fail a madness check, your fatigue increases by 1. If you fall unconscious while you have fatigue, your Sanity decreases by 1d6.

You are in control of your own thoughts. You may begin to hear whispers the closer you get to 80. The voice behind these whispers has a personality that is up to your DM, but has long since fallen to Madness.
You become unsettled. Make a Madness check whenever your hit points falls below half your hit point maximum.
You have begun to laugh. Lots. Make a Madness check whenever you make a Wisdom saving throw.
At your DMs discretion, you sometimes speak with the voice of another. Seizing the blight both thrills and terrifies you. Make a Madness check whenever you stop channeling the blight.

Your mind is all but lost to you. Any stressful situation might drive you to extreme behavior. In addition to being fatigued, whenever you fail a Madness check, roll a d100. On a roll of 10 or below, your body becomes temporarily possessed by the voice in your head. The DM determines how this voice acts. You can make a Madness check contested by the Madness check of your voice to regain possession of your body. You do not suffer the negative effects of failing a madness check, although you do not gain back control. A greater restoration spell can also be used to regain control of your body.

You are so far gone with Madness, it becomes a permanent condition. You automatically fail all Madness Checks, and you are irredeemably insane. If you lose your body due to failing the percentile roll, you can only gain it back by the effects of a Greater Restoration spell.

description.p: While channeling, you are immune to any spell or effect other than your own that would alter your form.
You are considered a full caster for the purposes of spell level advancement and proficiencies.

sheet.description: While channeling, you are immune to any spell or effect other than your own that would alter your form.

description.p: Starting at first level, as an action while channeling, or as part of the action used to begin channeling, you can magically assume the shape of a beast that you have seen before. Doing so requires concentration, but otherwise allows you to continue channeling and using other class features while transformed. You can transform into any beast that has a challenge rating of ½ or lower. You can revert to your normal form at any point on your turn by dropping concentration. You automatically revert if you fall unconscious, drop to 0 hit points, or die.
While you are transformed, the following rules apply:

ul.li: Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but you retain your alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. If the creature has the same proficiency as you and the bonus in its stat block is higher than yours, use the creature’s bonus instead of yours. If the creature has any legendary or lair actions, you can't use them.

When you transform, you assume the beast’s hit points and Hit Dice. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. However, if you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form. For example, if you take 10 damage in animal form and have only 1 hit point left, you revert and take 9 damage. As long as the excess damage doesn’t reduce your normal form to 0 hit points, you aren’t knocked unconscious.

Your ability to speak or take any action that requires hands is limited to the capabilities of your beast form. You retain the benefit of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them if the new form is physically capable of doing so. However, you can’t use any of your special senses, such as darkvision, unless your new form also has that sense.

You choose whether your equipment falls to the ground in your space, merges into your new form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal, but the DM decides whether it is practical for the new form to wear a piece of equipment, based on the creature’s shape and size. Your equipment doesn’t change size or shape to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can’t wear must either fall to the ground or merge with it. Equipment that merges with the form has no effect until you leave the form.

Additionally, you can use your spellcasting modifier in place of the primary stat for attack and damage rolls.

Additionally, your attacks in transformed form count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

description.p: At 10th level, you have mastered the physical forms of your transformations. Transformations gain more hit points than normal: Spell level hit points per Hit Die it has.
Additionally, you have advantage on constitution saving throws made to preserve the effects of a transformation.

Additionally, all forms gain the ability to speak.

description.p: At 20th level, your mastery over form manipulation is unrivaled. You can transform into any beast or dragon that has a challenge rating equal to your spell level. Transforming into a dragon no longer costs fatigue.

You are considered a half caster for the purposes of spell level advancement and proficiencies, and use Intelligence as your spell casting modifier.

description.p: Starting at first level, you gain a substitute for Vis. Whenever you would create a mote of Vis for one of the forms, you instead create a mote of Vim. Vim functions similarly to Vis, but contains all forms instead of one. Each form inside a mote of Vim can be burned independently of each other, and retain their individual durations.

description.p: At 6th level, you can temporarily flare one of your forms as a bonus action or reaction, doubling the rate at which it burns to strengthen its effects.
Air (Flared) - You cannot be frightened, do not have a range restriction on smoking creatures, have partial cover, and you can’t be detected by Flared Water.
Earth (Flared) - Range increases to 120ft, pushing/pulling force is doubled, damage increased to 2d12.
Fire (Flared) - You gain one use of your reaction per turn, can see through magical darkness, and creatures do not benefit from being invisible against you.

Life (Flared) - You gain temp hp at the start of your turn equal to your level. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

Mind (Flared) - Whenever you roll a Charisma ability check, you can treat a roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as a 10. As a bonus action you can attempt to enrage a target, fueling any hostilities to the point of mindless violence. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or it becomes incapable of distinguishing creatures apart from its most hated enemy until the end of your next turn.
Water (Flared) - Can detect and affect creatures being masked by Air, destroyed weaves lash out at the casters mind dealing 1d4 Psychic damage for each spell level of the destroyed spell.
